user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_Application_Startup:
```c
void OS_Application_Startup(void)
{
    int32 Status;

    Status = OS_API_Init();
    if (Status != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        BSP_DEBUG("Error: OS_API_Init() failed with status=%d\n", (int)Status);
        OS_ApplicationExit(Status);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
BSP_DEBUG("Error: OS_API_Init() failed with status=%d\n", (int)Status);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 1.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment uses a standard C cast ((int)Status) and a normal function/macro-style call with a printf-style format string. There is no evidence of any compiler-specific language extension in the shown code. (If BSP_DEBUG were implemented using a documented compiler extension, that implementation—not this call—would be the violation.)
